page.title: 18DERILICT LAND IN CONGLETON
page.content: At West Heath is a disused sand quarry which awaits development.At a meeting of the borough council in June 1983 the members took a wait and see attitude.They did not give a firm lead although planning permission was granted for light industry,recreation facilities and a hotel complex. Further development in 1984saw ideas for a housing estate put forward however the people of Congleton who live nearby wish to open the quarry as a leisure ground for the use of bathers,horse,riders and those wishing to picnic.This latter proposal has gained popular support in the shape of petitions and puplic meetings.The future of the quarry remains uncertain but clearlythe fate of the quarry has now become a matter of public cocern.
